extendedIngredients.name: chicory
extendedIngredients.original: 6 pounds mustard greens or chicory, stems discarded
extendedIngredients.originalName: mustard greens or chicory, stems discarded

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: red wine vinegar
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.original: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

title: Calabrese Mustard Greens
summary: Calabrese Mustard Greens is a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 side dish. This recipe serves 8 and costs $1.39 per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 4g of protein, 14g of fat, and a total of 182 calories. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 50 minutes. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. Head to the store and pick up chicory, wine vinegar, garlic cloves, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 91%. This score is outstanding. Try Calabrese Mustard Greens, Perfect Southern Greens (Kale, Beet, Collard Greens, Mustard), and Braised Collard Greens, Mustard Greens, and Red Swiss Chard for similar recipes.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add half of the greens and cook, stirring a few times, until just tender, about 3 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the greens to a colander and rinse with cold water. Repeat with the remaining greens. Drain very well. Coarsely chop the greens.                                              In a large, deep skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and crushed red pepper and cook over moderate heat until the garlic is golden brown, about 1 minute. Add the greens and stir well. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the greens are heated through, about 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the greens to a large bowl and let cool to room temperature. Stir in the vinegar and serve.

steps.step: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.

Add half of the greens and cook, stirring a few times, until just tender, about 3 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the greens to a colander and rinse with cold water. Repeat with the remaining greens.
Drain very well. Coarsely chop the greens.
In a large, deep skillet, heat the olive oil.
Add the garlic and crushed red pepper and cook over moderate heat until the garlic is golden brown, about 1 minute.
Add the greens and stir well. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the greens are heated through, about 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the greens to a large bowl and let cool to room temperature. Stir in the vinegar and serve.
